Let $ ABCD$ be a parallelogram and let $ \overrightarrow{AA^\prime}$, $ \overrightarrow{BB^\prime}$, $ \overrightarrow{CC^\prime}$, and $ \overrightarrow{DD^\prime}$ be parallel rays in space on the same side of the plane determined by $ ABCD$. If $ AA^\prime = 10$, $ BB^\prime = 8$, $ CC^\prime = 18$, $ DD^\prime = 22$, and $ M$ and $ N$ are the midpoints of $ \overline{A^{\prime}C^{\prime}}$ and $ \overline{B^{\prime}D^{\prime}}$, respectively, then $ MN =$\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 0\qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 1\qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 2\qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ 3\qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ 4$
